headline.main: Gene Variant Is Linked to Common Type of Stroke

docs.lead_paragraph: The gene variant appears to predispose a person to strokes, but it seems more prevalent in Asians than in people of European or African descent.

headline.print_headline: Yet Another Worry for Those Who Believe the Glass Is Half-Empty
headline.main: Yet Another Worry for Those Who Believe the Glass Is Half-Empty

docs.lead_paragraph: Pessimists have enough to fret about without worrying that their own temperament will doom them to a short life.

headline.main: Gene Variant Is Linked to Common Type of Stroke, Especially Among Asians

docs.abstract: Dr Michiaki Kubo, Institute of Physical and Chemical Research, Japan, leads study that identifies variant gene that predisposes person to cerebral strokes; suggests that carrier of gene be monitored closely for risk of stroke; research is published in journal Nature Genetics (M)

keywords.value: INSTITUTE OF PHYSICAL AND CHEMICAL RESEARCH
keywords.name: organizations

docs.lead_paragraph: Japanese researchers have identified a gene variant that appears to predispose a person to strokes, but it seems more prevalent in Asians than in people of European or African descent. In a paper to be published next month in the journal Nature Genetics, researchers write that the presence of the variant raised the risk of cerebral infarction, the most common type of stroke, by 40 percent.
